key_facts: Rising global temperatures are worsening cardiovascular disease in Australia.
Cardiovascular disease is a leading cause of death in Australia.
Heat significantly contributes to heart-related health issues.
The Northern Territory is especially affected by heat-related heart problems.
The burden of heat-related heart disease could double in 25 years.
Vulnerable populations include the elderly and those with chronic conditions.
The study calls for wellness check-ins and heat safety education.
Experts believe similar trends are likely worldwide.
Public health policies must address climate-related health risks.
